Title: Object: The Saracenic Hall of Jusuf, at Cairo
Series: Views in Egypt and Nubia
Description: View of the ruin, wall with arches and classical columns in the right middle distance, oriental man sitting on fragment in the right foreground, two other men standing behind to the left, circular building in the left background; after Bossi. 1824 Lithograph, printed on chine collé
Curator's comments: 'Views in Egypt and Nubia' was originally published for private circulation in 1824, consisting of lithographs after drawings by Bossi who accompanied Edward Joshua Cooper's journey in the Nile in 1820-1. (DNB, under Edward Joshua Cooper) The series was later published by John Murray in 1824, probably with additional illustrations and vignettes. (Copy in BL) The series seems to be also known as 'Egyptian Scenery', but this publication detail is unknown. Not in Abbey.
